docs.lead_paragraph: Men ages 19 to 29 are three times as likely as women in the same age group not to wear their seat belts, government researchers say. While overall seat belt use is continuing to climb, young men are among several groups that appear reluctant to change their habits, according to a study by the federal Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality.
docs.abstract: May Chu, Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality statistician, reports that men ages 19 to 29 are three times as likely as women who are same age not to wear seat belts; overall seat belt use is up, with 88 percent of people saying they use seat belts compared to only 68 percent in 1996; drawing (S)
docs.snippet: Men ages 19 to 29 are three times as likely as women in the same age group not to wear their seat belts, government researchers say.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: AGENCY FOR HEALTHCARE RESEARCH AND QUALITY

docs.lead_paragraph: Providing psychological services for millions who have lost family members, homes and communities in Sri Lanka, Indonesia and other countries will become critical in the coming weeks, officials from the World Health Organization, Unicef, and other relief agencies say. The scope of the emotional fallout will be impossible to predict. The first priority, the officials said, is to deliver food, shelter and drinking water. But the United Nations has already set up a network for counseling in Sri Lanka and, on Friday, sent mental health workers to the Maldives.

headline.main: After Food and Shelter, Help in Coping With Unbearable Loss

docs.abstract: World Health Organization, Unicef and other relief agencies stress need for psychological services for millions suffering emotional and physical loss in countries impacted by December tsunami; hold that severe traumatic reactions are most prevalent in impact zone of apocalyptic event; other catastrophic events and emotional fallout in various regions described (M)
docs.snippet: Providing psychological services for millions in Asia will become critical in the coming weeks.
